page.title: 09Landscape-Gleadless/Norton
page.content: The 600' contour runs along White Lane and the land falls away to the Moss Beck.To the north of White Lane the land rises slighty to form a ridge.There is nothing higher between here and the coast.There are extensive views over the city.The ridge divides the rural and urban sectors of the area. From the Norton water tower,looking west down the Valley,you can see the tops of the houses and,in the distance, the shops.The people who live on Gibbons drive can see a single road and dual carriage way.There are lots of trees on the side of the road.From their back window they can see the garage. The panorama from lightwood lane is electric pylons,old warehouses and flats.From Blackstock Rd.you can see a church,a pub,shops,& Hemsworth library.
